children.name: Plan and Procure Metering Assets
children.objective: Analyze deployment schedules, replacement rates, and network growth to forecast device demand, and execute necessary procurement actions, including purchase order issuance and vendor coordination, to ensure adequate inventory supply.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Receive and inspect delivered assets
children.objective: Receive hardware shipments at utility warehouses, including verifying vendor packing lists against purchase orders in the Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) system, conducting physical inspections and statistical sample testing for conformance to technical specifications, and managing the disposition of failed or damaged assets through quarantine and vendor return workflows.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Register devices in asset and head-end systems
children.objective: Onboard of new metering and network assets, involving the ingestion of vendor shipment files to create serialized asset records in the EAM, and the subsequent synchronization of this master data to the Head-End System (HES) and Meter Data Management System (MDMS) to establish initial device state and cross-system linkages, including resolving data loading errors or identifier mismatches.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Track warehouse inventory and movements
children.objective: Manage the physical location and status of assets within the warehouse (e.g., staging, quarantine) and ensures that any changes in asset condition or availability are automatically propagated to the Head-End System and other integrated IT platforms. This ensures only available, healthy assets are released for deployment.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Reconcile field inventory and system counts
children.objective: Perform comprehensive periodic audits to balance total asset quantities across utility warehouses, vendor (MIV) storage, and deployed field locations against central system records. This process identifies lost, stolen, or unaccounted-for assets that are not captured by individual installation transactions.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage Vendor Warranty Claims and Returns
children.objective: Manage the commercial lifecycle of metering devices under warranty, including validating warranty status, executing return merchandise authorization (RMA) shipments to the vendor, and reconciling financial credits or replacement asset receipts.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage Meter Refurbishment and Testing Cycles
children.objective: Manage the operational workflow for devices requiring testing, cleaning, or repair (internal or third-party) to determine if they can be refurbished and returned to available inventory stock or must be scrapped.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage returns, warranty, and refurbishment (network devices)
children.objective: Manage end-to-end lifecycle of defective or removed network infrastructure devices, including validating warranty status against vendor contracts, processing Return Merchandise Authorization (RMA) shipments via the EAM, managing internal or third-party refurbishment testing loops, and reconciling inventory records to reflect scrapped, returned, or restocked status.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage meter sample testing and acceptance
Perform New Meter Lot Acceptance Testing
children.objective: Define and execute statistical sampling and testing protocols for newly received meter shipments, driving requirements for automated workflows to manage test selection logic, record results against asset records, and enforce pass/fail criteria before releasing lots into inventory.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage MIV synchronization and file handling
Manage MIV Data Synchronization & Exception Handling
children.objective: Maintain MIV deployment job plans and ensure the accurate, bi-directional synchronization of deployment data between MIV and enterprise systems, including the detection and resolution of any file transfer or interface exceptions.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Reconcile installation records between systems
children.objective: Automated and manual data reconciliation activities required to ensure field installation data remains consistent across the core AMI landscape, specifically identifying, investigating, and resolving data discrepancies between the Meter Installation Vendor (MIV) system, EAM, CIS, MDMS, and HES regarding device status, premise association, and connectivity.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Notify customers of installation schedules
children.objective: Generate and deliver of pre-deployment notifications to customers based on the MIV's rolling deployment schedule, utilizing customer data from CIS to determine preferred channels (e.g., email, mail, text) and language requirements, conveying critical information regarding access needs and temporary outages, and managing undeliverable notifications.
children.use_case: Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience

children.name: Communicate completion and follow-up
children.objective: Trigger post-installation communications once a meter exchange is successfully validated in utility systems (CIS/MDMS), confirming service restoration to the customer via their preferred channel, providing initial AMI educational materials, and managing follow-up surveys or inquiries related to the installation experience.
children.use_case: Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience

children.name: Assign and execute MIV meter deployment work orders
children.objective: Assign and executie installation work orders to the Meter Installation Vendor (MIV), from the initial grouping of premises based on deployment route planning to the digital dispatch of orders to MIV field devices, the physical execution of the meter exchange, and the field capture of completion data (including photos and GPS) or "Unable to Complete" (UTC) exception codes.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Assign and execute utility-owned deployment work orders
children.objective: Assign and execute installation work orders executed by internal utility field crews (often for complex metering or hard-to-access sites), involving the creation and dispatch of orders through the utility's Mobile Workforce Management (MWM) system, physical field execution, and the capture and synchronization of completion data back to EAM and CIS.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Close MIV work orders and update dashboards
children.objective: Ingest and validate completed work order files received daily from the MIV system, update premise and service status in CIS and EAM, trigger downstream provisioning processes, and feed deployment status dashboards while flagging data validation errors for back-office resolution.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage field exceptions and issue resolution
Resolve Physical Field Installation Exceptions (Unable to Complete)
children.objective: Manage the resolution workflow for physical barriers preventing MIV installation, such as access issues (e.g., locked gates, hazards), unsafe meter sockets, or customer refusals, requiring coordination with field ops or customer service.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Resolve Deployment Data and System Exceptions
children.objective: Investigate and resolve back-office data exceptions where a physical installation occurred, but system records fail to synchronize due to data errors (e.g., serial number mismatches, incorrect premise association) between MIV, Asset Management, and CIS.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage refurbishment and end-of-life disposal (MIV)
children.objective: Track activities for legacy meters removed by the MIV, including the physical reverse logistics from field to warehouse, sorting assets for potential testing/refurbishment versus scrapping, and ensuring vendor compliance with environmental regulations for disposal, all while maintaining asset tracking capability within the EAM until final disposition.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Perform provisioning and connectivity validation
children.objective: Discover and register the new meter onto the RF mesh network (via the HES)  immediately following physical installation, where the Head-End System (HES) attempts to; validating its security credentials and establishing bidirectional communications, and flagging non-communicating devices for immediate network troubleshooting
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Perform commissioning and billing readiness checks
children.objective: Transition a newly installed meter from "installed" status to "billing active," ensuring that interval data is successfully flowing from the HES to the MDMS, that initial VEE rules are applied without critical errors, and that the MDMS and CIS are aligned on the device configuration to enable accurate future billing.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Perform steady-state meter installation
children.objective: Perform (BAU) meter installations (e.g., new construction, reactive replacements), initiated by CIS or EAM requests, flowing through Mobile Workforce Management (MWM) for utility crew dispatch, field execution, and the subsequent back-office provisioning and system synchronization steps.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Perform meter exchange
children.objective: Replace AMI 2.0 meter for maintenance, testing, or upgrade purposes.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Conduct AMI Network & Communication Field Investigations
children.objective: Dispatch and execute field investigations specifically tasked with diagnosing and resolving persistent meter communication failures, utilizing RF diagnostic tools and coordinating with head-end system operators.
children.use_case: Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets

children.name: Conduct Field Revenue Protection & Tampering Investigations
children.objective: Dispatch specialized field personnel to investigate physical sites flagged for potential energy diversion, tampering, or abnormal consumption patterns, requiring specific evidence gathering and safety protocols.
children.use_case: Use Case 4 – Revenue Protection

children.name: Perform meter removal and decommissioning
children.objective: Physically remove metering assets from the field (due to service retirement or defect), capture of a certified final register read for billing closure in CIS, change the asset status in EAM to "removed," and de-provision the device credentials in the HES to prevent unauthorized future network access.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Perform remote disconnect / reconnect for move-out
children.objective: Perform automated workflow triggered by a customer move-out request in CIS, orchestrating a remote disconnect command via the MDMS and HES to the meter's internal switch, validating successful state change via HES feedback, and updating service status in CIS, including handling communication failures that require a manual field truck roll.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Perform remote disconnect / reconnect for move-in
children.objective: Peform automated workflow triggered by a new customer move-in request in CIS, orchestrating a remote connect command via the MDMS and HES to restore service, validating voltage presence at the meter, and updating account status in CIS, including managing exceptions where MDMS safety checks prevent remote reconnection.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Perform remote disconnect for non-payment
children.objective: Conduct workflow initiated by the CIS collections module for delinquent accounts, validating eligibility for remote disconnection, executing the command via MDMS and HES, and updating the account credit status, while rigorously managing exceptions for critical care customers or medical baseline accounts identified in CIS.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Perform remote reconnect after payment
children.objective: Conduct near-real-time workflow triggered by payment receipt in CIS, immediately issuing a remote reconnect command via MDMS and HES to restore service, verifying successful reconnection through meter feedback, and notifying the customer, including handling technical failures that delay restoration.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Install and maintain network access points
children.objective: Manage installation of AMI field network infrastructure (e.g., Take-out Points, Relays), involving site acquisition planning, work order generation in EAM for installation or maintenance, field execution by telecommunications crews, and the technical commissioning of the devices into the HES network management layer.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Remove network access points and decommission interfaces
children.objective: Removal and decommission network infrastructure devices including required field work orders from EAM, updates topology maps in the HES to reflect the removal, and updates to asset status in EAM to ensure accurate network inventory.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage AMI data collection and validation
Execute AMI Data Acquisition & Initial Validation (HES)
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end acquisition of interval, voltage, and event data from Head-End Systems, including initial intake validation, automated resolution of transmission gaps or anomalies, and the final persistence of validated data into the MDMS and analytics repositories for downstream use.
children.use_case:
Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash
Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets
Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Execute VEE and Exception Management
children.objective: Apply automated Validation, Estimation, and Editing (VEE) rules to interval data to ensure billing completeness and accuracy, and manually investigate and resolve any complex data exceptions that fail automated processing.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Configure and Tune VEE Rules
children.objective: Define, configure, test, and deploy automated VEE rules within the MDMS, requiring system capabilities for user-configurable rule editors (non-code based), rule version control, and simulation "sandbox" environments to tune thresholds and gauge impact against historical data before production deployment.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Manage Long-Term Data Archival and Retrieval
children.objective: Implement and enforce data retention policies (e.g., 40+ months) through automated system configurations that tier data storage based on age (Information Lifecycle Management), and manage on-demand retrieval requests requiring accessible user interfaces and defined system performance SLAs for restoring archived data.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Detect Unassigned Interval Usage
children.objective: Continuously monitor interval data from meters with a "disconnected" service status in CIS, identifying instances where voltage or load is detected despite the expected open switch state, and generating investigation cases for Revenue Protection to address potential tampering or switch failures.
children.use_case: Use Case 4 – Revenue Protection

children.name: Resolve AMI billing data mismatches
children.objective: Establish a traceable audit trail verifying that 100% of validated billable determinants are successfully transmitted from the MDMS to the CIS prior to bill calculation. This process mitigates the fundamental business risk of "silent data loss" inherent in high-volume AMI integrations, providing necessary assurance for financial reporting and regulatory compliance that testing alone cannot guarantee.
children.use_case:
Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash
Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience

children.name: Calculate and validate time-varying (TOU/TVP) energy bills
children.objective: Execute CIS billing logic for rates where interval energy usage (kWh) is aggregated into pre-defined time-based buckets (e.g., On-Peak, Off-Peak, Seasonal periods) according to fixed schedules.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Calculate and validate Demand (kW) and Coincident Peak bills
children.objective: Execute CIS billing logic that requires time-series analysis to determine peak power demand (kW), including non-coincident peaks, coincident system peaks, and complex structures like demand ratchets or power factor adjustments.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Calculate and validate Dynamic and Real-Time Pricing (RTP) bills
children.objective: Execute CIS billing logic for rates subject to dynamic triggers or rapidly changing price signals (e.g., Critical Peak Pricing events, hourly wholesale market pricing) often requiring integration with external price signal feeds.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Calculate and validate register-based bills
children.objective: Execute traditional billing cycles within the CIS for accounts remaining on scalar rates, utilizing validated start and stop register reads passed from the MDMS, applying rate schedules, calculating usage and charges, and performing pre-bill validation checks to identify and hold anomalous bills for manual review.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Generate and distribute bill print and e-bills
children.objective: Format, generate and distribute final customer billing statements following successful bill calculation in CIS, managing interfaces to third-party print vendors for physical mail and digital platforms for e-bill delivery, and tracking delivery status while managing exceptions related to invalid addresses or bounced emails.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Manage System-Detected Data Anomalies & Technical Exceptions
children.objective: Investigate and resolve high-volume, system-generated exceptions triggered by pre-billing validation failures related to missing, incomplete, or technically invalid metering data inputs (e.g., register mismatches, stopped meter flags) to allow the billing cycle to proceed.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Manage Rate Application & Business Logic Exceptions
children.objective: Analyze and correct complex system exceptions stemming from failures in applying business rules or rate configurations during bill calculation (e.g., missing rate determinants, proration errors, net energy metering setup issues) to ensure accurate final bill generation.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Manage Customer Billing Disputes & High Bill Investigations
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end workflow for customer-initiated inquiries disputing billed amounts, requiring deep-dive investigations into usage history, rate application, and potential meter issues to provide satisfactory explanations or initiate necessary adjustments.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Cancel and rebill
children.objective: Execute workflow required to correct previously issued bills within CIS, triggered by revised usage data from MDMS or retroactive rate changes, involving the reversal of original financial charges, recalculation based on corrected parameters, generation of a corrected statement, and management of customer notification regarding the adjustment.
children.use_case: Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash

children.name: Manage Virtual Net Metering (VNM) Allocations
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of Virtual Net Metering arrangements, defining the complex virtual relationships between a central generating facility and multiple non-colocated beneficiary accounts (e.g., tenants), and maintaining the dynamic percentage-based credit allocation schedules required to distribute generation credits accurately on ongoing monthly bills.
children.use_case:
Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash
Use Case 2 – Optimizing Energy Savings
Use Case 7 – Long-Term Grid Planning

children.name: Manage NEM Aggregation (NEM-A) Structures
children.objective: Establish and maintain the complex account hierarchies required for regulatory NEM Aggregation, linking a principal generating account with multiple eligible, often contiguous, usage premises under a single customer ownership to enable a unified, aggregated billing settlement where total generation offsets total combined load.
children.use_case:
Use Case 1 – Meter-to-Cash
Use Case 2 – Optimizing Energy Savings
Use Case 7 – Long-Term Grid Planning

children.name: Handle General AMI Customer Inquiries (Tier 1)
children.objective: Respond to high-volume, general customer questions regarding AMI deployment schedules, meter functionality, basic usage education, and AMI program benefits using standard knowledge base tools and scripts.
children.use_case: Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience

children.name: Resolve Complex Technical Billing & Usage Inquiries (Tier 2/3)
children.objective: Manage escalated customer inquiries that require deep technical investigation into interval usage data, meter event logs (HES), and VEE history (MDMS) to resolve complex billing disputes or perceived metering inaccuracies.
children.use_case: Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience

children.name: Manage Revenue Protection Lifecycle
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end revenue protection lifecycle by analyzing meter alarms and usage patterns to detect potential energy diversion, conducting data-driven and field investigations to confirm and resolve theft cases, and tracking program performance through KPI reporting and trend analysis.
children.use_case: Use Case 4 – Revenue Protection

children.name: Manage opt-out and customer choice programs
Manage Pre-Deployment Opt-Out Exclusions
children.objective: Manager customer requests to refuse smart meter installation before deployment, involving capturing the request in CIS/CRM, validating eligibility against regulatory rules, and critically, integrating with the MIV deployment planning system to place a "do not install" hold on the premise to prevent accidental installation.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage Post-Deployment Opt-Out & Exchange
children.objective: Manage customer requests to opt-out after an AMI meter has been installed, involving eligibility validation in CIS, generating a field work order in EAM/MWM to exchange the communicating meter for a non-communicating digital device, and updating CIS billing parameters to reflect the opt-out status and any associated fees.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Disable AMI communications for opt-out customers
children.objective: Execute disabling the RF radio capability on an existing AMI meter for customers who choose to opt-out but where a physical meter exchange is not immediately required or possible, involving issuing a configuration command from the HES and verifying the cessation of communication.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Enable AMI communications for re-enrolled customers
children.objective: Execute re-enabling the RF radio capability on a previously disabled AMI meter for customers who choose to opt-in to the AMI program, involving issuing a configuration command from the HES, verifying network re-registration, and updating CIS status.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Process Opt-Out Customer Move-In Requests
children.objective: Manage service initiation requests for customers electing to opt-out at a new premise, including validating eligibility, configuring account enrollment settings, and triggering necessary field work orders to ensure a non-communicating meter is installed at the start of service.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Process Opt-Out Customer Move-Out and Asset Disposition
children.objective: Manage service termination for existing opt-out customers, including finalizing billing and executing business rules to determine the immediate disposition of the non-communicating meter remaining at the vacated premise (e.g., scheduling replacement or flagging for the next occupant).
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Provide personalized consumption insights
children.objective: Generate and deliver value-added energy intelligence to customers via web portals and mobile apps, utilizing MDMS interval data fed into an analytics engine to provide usage breakdowns, peer comparisons, and personalized efficiency tips, requiring robust integration between MDMS, analytics platforms, and customer-facing channels.
children.use_case: Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience

children.name: Perform Wholesale Aggregation and Settlement Reconciliation
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end wholesale settlement process by aggregating validated interval data according to market rules for submission to the ISO/RTO, and performing balancing calculations against top-down substation inputs to determine and allocate Unaccounted for Energy (UFE).
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Manage rate optimization and program enrollment
Provide Personalized Rate Recommendations and Bill Simulations
children.objective: Analyze customer usage patterns and behavioral data to model and recommend optimal rate structures, and generate simulated bill comparisons to clearly communicate the financial impact of potential rate changes or program participation.
children.use_case: Use Case 2 – Optimizing Energy Savings with Personalized Incentives

children.name: Manage Demand Response Event Settlement
children.objective: Execute post-event workflow within the MDMS or a separate DR Management System to determine financial settlements for demand response participants, involving calculating Customer Baseline Loads (CBL) using historical interval data, measuring actual performance during the event window, calculating credits or penalties based on program rules, and passing these financial determinants to CIS for billing application.
children.use_case: Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience

children.name: Manage EV Panel Capacity Limits
children.objective: Manage configuration within the HES/MDMS or Distributed Intelligence platform to define and maintain service panel capacity constraints for individual premises, pushing these parameters to edge applications on the meter to enable localized, autonomous throttling of EV charging load to prevent panel overloads.
children.use_case:
Use Case 3 – Improve Customer Experience
Use Case 7 – Long-Term Grid Planning

children.name: Manage customer data access and transparency
Manage Secure Third-Party Data Access (Green Button)
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of secure third-party data access, including authenticating requests from customers and authorized third parties, securely generating and delivering usage and generation data via APIs, and maintaining comprehensive audit logs to ensure compliance and detect misuse.
children.use_case: Use Case 6 – 3rd Party Meter Data Access

children.name: Manage Distribution Connectivity Model Lifecycle
children.objective: Establish and refine parent-child physical links between meters and service transformers using AMI voltage correlation data, continuously validate model accuracy through AMI and GIS feedback loops, and integrate the verified connectivity model with outage management and DER planning tools for enhanced situational awareness and operational decision-making.
children.use_case:
Use Case 11 – Distribution Connectivity Model & Monitoring
Use Case 18 - Grid Ops: Situational Awareness

children.name: Detect and Reconcile Phase Assignment Errors
children.objective: Process high-resolution voltage angle data or phase identification signal results from AMI meters (using MDMS or grid analytics platforms), identifying discrepancies between physical phase connectivity and the record in GIS, and generating data correction requests to update the connectivity model.
children.use_case: Use Case 11 – Distribution Connectivity Model & Monitoring

children.name: Monitor Environmental Sensor Telemetry
children.objective: Ingest, process and monitor of non-standard telemetry streams from AMI-enabled environmental sensors via the HES and MDMS, making this data available to operational dashboards and planning systems for situational awareness regarding localized weather, seismic events, or air quality conditions.
children.use_case: Use Case 9 – Environmental Monitoring

children.name: Identify and classify EV charging signatures
children.objective: Identify premises with Electric Vehicle (EV) chargers based on characteristic load signatures (magnitude, duration, time of use), tagging these premises in CIS/MDMS to refine load forecasting models and target EV-specific programs.
children.use_case: Use Case 18 – Grid Ops: Situational Awareness

children.name: Detect rooftop solar (PV) generation
children.objective: Identify customer-installed photovoltaic (PV) generation events by analyzing AMI interval data for reverse power flow signatures during daylight hours and correlating inverter harmonic signatures.
children.use_case: Use Case 18 – Grid Ops: Situational Awareness

children.name: Detect battery storage operation
children.objective: Identify behind-the-meter battery storage systems by analyzing AMI data for characteristic charging and discharging load patterns that are distinct from solar generation profiles, such as load shifting or peak shaving behavior.
children.use_case: Use Case 18 – Grid Ops: Situational Awareness

children.name: Correlate load changes with customer profiles
children.objective: Combine interval load data from the MDMS with demographic, program participation, and premises data from CIS to create rich customer load profiles, improve the accuracy of demand forecasting and enabe more nuanced detection of abnormal usage patterns.
children.use_case:
Use Case 7 – Long-Term Grid Planning
Use Case 18 - Grid Ops: Situational Awareness

children.name: Detect Unapproved DER Interconnection
children.objective: Detect meters (using HES or MDMS data) showing persistent reverse power flow (generation) signatures, compare these flags against approved interconnection records in CIS/EAM, and generate investigation cases for unapproved installations that pose safety or grid reliability risks.
children.use_case:
Use Case 8 – Anomaly & Fault Detection BTM
Use Case 4 – Revenue Protection

children.name: Aggregate and monitor feeder and transformer loads
children.objective: Aggregate individual meter interval data from the MDMS up through the defined GIS connectivity model to calculate total loading on service transformers and feeder sections, monitoring these aggregated values against equipment ratings to detect overloading or severe phase imbalances.
children.use_case: Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets

children.name: Perform Manual/Advisory Corrective Switching for Load Balancing
children.objective: Manage the operational workflow where AMI-driven loading insights trigger alerts or recommendations for grid operators, who then manually analyze and execute preventative switching actions to balance feeder or transformer loads.
children.use_case: Use Case 12 – Switching Support, Outage Selection, and Controlled Restoration

children.name: Execute Automated Corrective Switching (FLISR/ADMS)
children.objective: Manage the fully autonomous, machine-speed process where the ADMS/FLISR system utilizes real-time AMI and SCADA data to automatically detect imminent overload conditions and execute complex switching sequences to reconfigure the grid without human intervention.
children.use_case: Use Case 12 – Switching Support, Outage Selection, and Controlled Restoration

children.name: Detect voltage and power quality issues
Analyze voltage, frequency, and harmonic data
children.objective: Continuously monitor and ingest high-resolution voltage, frequency, and harmonic data from diverse AMI endpoints to establish baseline grid performance and identify statistical deviations that indicate potential power quality issues.
children.use_case: Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets

children.name: Classify and report power quality anomalies
children.objective: Apply analytical rules to categorize identified deviations into specific power quality events (e.g., sags, swells, harmonic distortion) and generate prioritized alerts and reports for grid operations engineering to investigate.
children.use_case: Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets

children.name: Perform Open-Loop (Advisory) Volt/VAR Optimization
children.objective: Utilize aggregated AMI edge voltage data to model grid conditions and generate optimized control recommendations for regulators and capacitor banks, which are presented to grid operators for manual review and execution.
children.use_case: Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets

children.name: Execute Closed-Loop (Autonomous) Volt/VAR Optimization
children.objective: Manage the fully autonomous, continuous process where the ADMS utilizes real-time AMI voltage feedback to automatically calculate and execute control commands for grid assets to maintain optimal voltage profiles (e.g., CVR) without operator intervention.
children.use_case: Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets

children.name: Perform grid fault and incipient failure detection
Perform AMI-Driven Fault Detection and Predictive Maintenance
children.objective: Utilize advanced analytics to detect incipient failure signatures in distribution assets using AMI power quality data, correlate these findings with SCADA and other sensor inputs for precise fault localization, and generate prioritized maintenance recommendations to prevent equipment failures.
children.use_case: Use Case 15 – Fault & Incipient Fault Identification on the Distribution System

children.name: Detect and Respond to Hot Socket Alarms
children.objective: Identify high-temperature alarms from meter event logs in the HES and conduct immediate automated validation logic in the HES/MDMS to filter false positives, followed by instantaneous execution of a remote disconnect command (if enabled) and/or high-priority dispatch of field crews via OMS/MWM to investigate a potential fire hazard.
children.use_case:
Use Case 8 – Anomaly & Fault Detection BTM
Use Case 5 – Advanced Outage Identification

children.name: Identify and Resolve Neutral Connection Issues
children.objective: Identify characteristic signatures of a floating or loose neutral connection at a premise or transformer (using HES and/or MDMS voltage and impedance data to), generating prioritized preventative maintenance orders in EAM/MWM before the condition leads to customer equipment damage or safety issues.
children.use_case:
Use Case 8 – Anomaly & Fault Detection BTM
Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets

children.name: Perform AMI Outage Detection, Validation, and Prioritization
children.objective: Manage the automated technical process of ingesting raw AMI telemetry (e.g., last gasps, power restoration signals), filtering false positives, validating events against existing grid conditions, and applying algorithmic rules to cluster individual meter events into prioritized outage incident records for dispatch.
children.use_case: Use Case 5 – Advanced Outage Identification and Location Awareness

children.name: Coordinate Operational Response and Cross-Team Alignment
children.objective: Manage the operational workflow that occurs once an outage incident is confirmed, ensuring real-time synchronization of outage status, estimated restoration times (ERTs), and crew progress between the control room, field operations, and customer service platforms to maintain situational awareness across teams.
children.use_case: Use Case 5 – Advanced Outage Identification and Location Awareness

children.name: Ping meters for outage verification
children.objective: Execute on-demand "system pings" from the OMS or grid operations desk via the HES to a select group of meters to surgically verify the scope of an outage area or confirm partial restoration scenarios (e.g., "nested" outages), without prematurely triggering automated restoration logic in the OMS.
children.use_case: Use Case 5 – Advanced Outage Identification and Location Awareness

children.name: Execute and Verify Power Restoration
children.objective: Execute operator-approved switching commands to restore service after an outage, monitor the staged restoration sequence using AMI telemetry, and verify final power restoration status to update the OMS and customer communication systems with authoritative confirmation.
children.use_case: Use Case 12 – Switching Support, Outage Selection, and Controlled Restoration

children.name: Deliver outage and restoration notifications to customers
children.objective: Deliver automated, multi-channel communications triggered by outage events and status changes in the OMS, utilizing customer contact preferences from CIS to deliver timely notifications regarding outage confirmation, estimated restoration times (ERTs), and final restoration verification via text, email, or voice.

children.name: Perform event analysis and root-cause investigation
Analyze waveform signatures
children.objective: This process encompasses the advanced engineering workflow of requesting on-demand high-resolution waveform data captures from capable meters via the HES following a complex grid event, and utilizing specialized power quality analysis software to interpret pre- and post-fault signatures to determine root cause (e.g., vegetation contact, equipment failure).
children.use_case:
Use Case 10 – Performance and Health of Distribution System Assets
Use Case 13 – Post Event Analysis

children.name: Perform Post-Event Forensic Analysis and Root Cause Investigation
children.objective: Systematically reconstruct outage and restoration sequences using multi-source data (AMI, OMS, SCADA), analyze data correlations to determine root causes of faults or power quality events, and formally document findings, corrective actions, and lessons learned to close the investigation loop.
children.use_case: Use Case 13 – Post Event Analysis

children.name: Manage Device Software, Configuration, and Security Lifecycle
Manage Device Firmware Upgrade Campaigns
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of firmware upgrade campaigns for meters and network devices, including planning target populations, scheduling deployment jobs, executing the upgrades, and validating successful deployment and subsequent device connectivity.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Manage Device Security Certificates Lifecycle
children.objective: Manage digital identities of all AMI devices, involving tracking certificate expiration dates within a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) management platform and the HES, planning and executing secure over-the-air certificate renewal campaigns before expiry to prevent devices from becoming permanently disconnected (orphaned) from the network.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Define and Manage Meter Configuration Programs
children.objective: Create, version-control, and manage a centralized repository of vendor-agnostic meter configuration profiles (programs), requiring system capabilities for secure library storage, change management logging, and role-based approval workflows to validate configurations prior to deployment authorization.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Manage Distributed Intelligence (DI) Application Lifecycle & Operations
children.objective: Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of distributed intelligence applications on the edge, including defining and tuning business logic parameters, coordinating the versioning, testing, and deployment of AI models and application binaries, and monitoring runtime performance and resource consumption to ensure operational health.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Execute on-demand reads or pings
children.objective: Execute real-time, ad-hoc commands from various upstream systems (CIS, MDMS, OMS) via the HES to retrieve instantaneous register reads for move-in/out verification or to ping devices to confirm network connectivity during troubleshooting workflows, handling success/failure responses from the field.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Send test or diagnostic commands
children.objective: Send specialized engineering commands via the HES to individual meters or groups to validate device health, retrieve diagnostic logs, confirm configuration parameter settings, or verify the successful application of a firmware patch, distinct from standard billing data retrieval.
children.use_case: Foundational – Not Directly Mapped to SCE Use Case

children.name: Track device reliability and communication performance
children.objective: Continuously monitor and analyze HES network performance data and device event logs to calculate reliability metrics (e.g., daily read success rates, mesh hop counts), identify poorly performing devices or network pockets, and detect systemic recurring issues for proactive maintenance.
children.use_case: Use Case 14 – AMI 2.0 Interoperability

children.name: Coordinate AMI data integration with enterprise data lake
children.objective: Operate and monitor of the data pipelines responsible for extracting validated interval, register, and event data from the MDMS operational data store and loading it into the enterprise Data Lake/Data Warehouse environment, ensuring data currency, completeness, and adherence to interface service level agreements (SLAs) for downstream analytics users.
